entries.title: South Korea boat capsizes, 9 fishermen missing

entries.title: Charles Kimbrough, 'Murphy Brown' actor, dead at 86

entries.description: Authorities are requesting help in identifying a body that was found in a Williamsburg retention pond on Jan. 25. The individual's cause of death was not released.

entries.title: George Santos' former staffer accuses congressman of sexual harassment, violating pay rules
entries.description: George Santos' former staffer said in an ethics complaint that the congressman sexually harassed him and violated House ethics' pay rules regarding his employment.

entries.title: 'Close Encounters of the Third Kind' and 'A Christmas Story' star Melinda Dillon dies at 83
entries.description: "A Christmas Story" star Melinda Dillon died at the age of 83 on Jan. 9. She was a two-time Academy Award nominee for her roles in "Close Encounters of the Third Kind" and "Absence of Malice."

entries.title: NYPD off-duty officer 'fighting for his life' after used vehicle purchase turns into armed robbery: officials
entries.description: An off-duty NYPD officer remains in critical condition after a shooting incident took place late Saturday night, said Mayor Eric Adams and NYPD Police Commissioner Keechant L. Sewell.

entries.title: On this day in history, Feb. 5, 1937, FDR announces plan to pack the Supreme Court
entries.description: On this day in history, Feb. 5, 1937, FDR planned to pack the Supreme Court to create support for his New Deal agenda, which sought to give government broader authority to help Americans recover post-Depression.

entries.title: Kate Middleton shares photo of herself as a baby as part of early childhood campaign
entries.description: Kate Middleton shared a baby photo of herself as part of a new campaign to raise awareness about the importance of early childhood years.

entries.title: Smokey Robinson shares the secret to his decades of success as he's honored with Berry Gordy at MusiCares Gala
entries.description: Motown icons Smokey Robinson and Berry Gordy were honored at the MusiCares Persons of the Year Gala on Friday night, ahead of the 65th Annual Grammy Awards.

entries.title: Richard Sherman, NFL players rip potential rule change that would ban ‘hip-drop' tackle
entries.description: Past and present NFL players have not taken kindly to the notion the league may be considering a rule which would make "hip-drop" style tackles illegal.

entries.title: Japan fires aide for anti-LGBTQ comments: 'Outrageous'
entries.description: Japan's prime minister fired a top aide on Saturday after the aide reportedly said he wouldn't want to live next to gay or lesbian couples or even look at them.

entries.title: Missing mom's husband considered 'person of interest' faces extradition to Indiana on unrelated charges
entries.description: Xavier Breland - a person of interest in his wife Ciera Breland's disappearance - is being extradited back to Indiana from Georgia on unrelated charges.

entries.title: New York school, food vendor apologize for serving chicken and waffles on first day of Black History Month
entries.description: A New York middle school and its food vendor have both apologized for serving chicken and waffles on the first day of Black History Month which upset some parents.

entries.title: James Harrison responds to Antonio Brown's claims Harrison caused receiver's 'CTE,' 'aggressive behavior'
entries.description: Shortly after free agent receiver Antonio Brown blamed former Pittsburgh Steeler James Harrison for giving him CTE, the Super Bowl XLIII hero had quite the response.

entries.title: China fumes after US pops its balloon, warns of possible ‘responses’ to ‘clear overreaction’
entries.description: The Chinese government said it disapproves of the U.S. decision to shoot down an unmanned surveillance balloon and warned it may have "responses" to that action.

entries.title: California 5-year-old remains upbeat despite mountain lion attack: 'His spirit remains intact'
entries.description: A California five-year-old is said to be in good spirits despite being attacked by a mountain lion resulting in lacerations, a facial fracture, and a hospital visit.

entries.title: Aaron Rodgers has message for former teammate Davante Adams as the receiver tries to recruit him to Raiders
entries.description: If Packers quarterback Aaron Rodgers is going to reunite with star receiver Davante Adams, he's going to need some help from the current Las Vegas Raider.

entries.title: Florida state trooper hospitalized following pursuit, shootout; 1 suspect dead
entries.description: A state trooper in Florida was shot by a suspect after a police pursuit on Interstate 75 near Tampa early Saturday morning. A second suspect was taken into custody.

entries.title: Republican demands Joe Biden, Kamala Harris resign after 'catastrophic Chinese spy balloon spectacle'
entries.description: Rep. Joe Wilson, R-S.C., demanded Saturday that both president Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris should resign after allowing a Chinese spy balloon to fly over America.

entries.title: Geno Smith gives update on contract talks with Seahawks: 'It's looking very good'
entries.description: Geno Smith appears optimistic about his prospects to return to Seattle. The pending free agent quarterback had a resurgent year in his first season as a starter since 2014.

entries.title: China experts predict Beijing’s next move after spy balloon shot down
entries.description: Several China experts predicted what Beijing's next move would be after their spy balloon that flew across America over several days was blown up by the U.S. military on Saturday.

entries.title: Biden's decision to 'allow' Chinese spy balloon over US is 'a joke,' Homeland Security committee member says
entries.description: A member of the House Committee on Homeland Security said that President Biden allowing the Chinese spy balloon to travel over the United States is a "joke."

entries.title: Pentagon working to recover Chinese spy balloon, expects valuable intel from it
entries.description: Defense officials said Saturday that the mission to recover a shot-down Chinese spy balloon was underway and was being conducted by U.S. Navy and Coast Guard personnel.

entries.title: Kentucky mom says Bryan Kohberger is her 'divine masculine' and claims she sent him letters and dolled up pics
entries.description: A Kentucky woman, who goes by the name Brittney J. Hislope on Facebook, wrote about her "love" for Bryan Kohberger, who's accused of killing four University of Idaho students.

entries.title: China's reaction to balloon takedown will offer 'very important clues' to how it operates: Gordon Chang
entries.description: China expert Gordon Chang weighs in on the Chinese spy balloon shot down by U.S. fighter jets off the coast of South Carolina as U.S.-China tensions grow on "Fox News Live."

entries.title: Nets' Kyrie Irving booed by home crowd after reportedly requesting trade
entries.description: Just one day after reports emerged that Kyrie Irving requested a trade from the Brooklyn Nets, the Barclays Center crowd let him know how it felt about his demands.

entries.title: Antonio Brown claims former teammate James Harrison caused his 'CTE' and 'super aggressive' behavior
entries.description: NFL free agent receiver Antonio Brown blamed his "super aggressive'" behavior on a hit he said he took from one of his former Pittsburgh Steelers teammates.
